nodes.bodyText:
please describe the difference:
filter.attribute(type=button)
vs
filter.attribute(disabled)
vs
filter.attribute(type=)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,3 +5,7 @@
 |textPart
 |Filter elements by their text parts.
 |tagName(h3)->filter.textPart(Welcome)
+
+|attribute
+|Filter elements by their attribute values
+|tagName(input)->filter.attribute(type=button) or tagName(input)->filter.attribute(disabled)

@@ -5,3 +5,9 @@
 |textPart
 |Filter elements by their text parts.
 |tagName(h3)->filter.textPart(Welcome)
+
+|attribute
+|Filter elements by their attribute values
+a|`xpath(input)->filter.attribute(type=button)` - input element has `type` attribute with `button` value
+`xpath(input)->filter.attribute(type)` - input element has `type` attribute with any value
+`xpath(input)->filter.attribute(type=)` - input element has `type` attribute empty value or without it

nodes.bodyText: empty value ->  with an empty value
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,3 +5,9 @@
 |textPart
 |Filter elements by their text parts.
 |tagName(h3)->filter.textPart(Welcome)
+
+|attribute
+|Filter elements by their attribute values
+a|`xpath(input)->filter.attribute(type=button)` - input element has `type` attribute with `button` value
+`xpath(input)->filter.attribute(type)` - input element has `type` attribute with any value
+`xpath(input)->filter.attribute(type=)` - input element has `type` attribute empty value or without it
